definition: (loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
(interj.) ha!/(onom. for laughter)/(slang) to be infatuated with/to adore/abbr. for 哈士奇[ha1 shi4 qi2], husky (dog)
abbr. for 哈薩克斯坦|哈萨克斯坦[Ha1 sa4 ke4 si1 tan3], Kazakhstan/abbr. for 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Harbin

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
Burj Khalifa, skyscraper in Dubai, 830 m high
Caliphate (Islamic empire formed after the death of the Prophet Mohammed 穆罕默德 in 632)

sentences.english: The Sunni caliph is the spiritual and political head of the community.
sentences.chinese: 遜尼派哈里發，是精神文明建設和政治領導社會。

sentences.english: The Dutch tried to stop their Muslim subjects deferring to the caliph in their public prayers.
sentences.chinese: 荷蘭則試圖制止它管理的穆斯林聽從哈里發的指示。

sentences.english: A machine gun obtained by Mahdi forces, now exhibiting in Al Khalifa Museum.
sentences.chinese: 陳列於喀土穆哈里發博物館的機槍。

sentences.english: The old beggar threw himself at the Caliph's feet.
sentences.chinese: 老乞丐撲倒在哈里發的腳下。

sentences.english: Saxen, now married and living in Berkeley, Calif., said after that incident, food was an escape.
sentences.chinese: 薩克森現已結婚並居住在哈里發的伯克利。

sentences.english: as mercenaries by the Baghdad caliphs.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏被巴格達哈里發僱爲僱傭軍。

sentences.english: In the 7th century, Islamic caliphs began to exert control over the area.
sentences.chinese: 在7世紀，伊斯蘭教的哈里發們開始控制這個地區。

sentences.english: Beginning with Selim, the Ottoman sultans also held the title of caliph, the spiritual head of Islam.
sentences.chinese: 自謝里姆一世，鄂圖曼蘇丹也擁有哈里發的頭銜。

sentences.english: The letter he sent to the caliph.
